result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenyata Antwone Course was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: ALL COUNTS: Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. Pay all applicable court costs and surcharges including DNA surcharges to be paid over the duration of probation or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered. Cash bail applied.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

- Defendant to register as a Sex Offender for 5 years.
- Defendant to undergo a Sex Offender Evaluation and comply with any treatment deemed necessary.

- AODA assessment and follow through with recommended programming.
- Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: With Good Time Credit and Huber for work and childcare not to exceed 60 hours a week. Defendant has a report date of 06-10-16 before 12pm.

charges.descr: Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child

Letter from Chantell James.

Huber/Work Release Modification Request:
Cancellation Of Huber / Work Release / Electronic Surveillance Privileges Pursuant To Wisconsin Statutes Section 303.08(2), 973.09(4), 973.03(4).
Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge McAdams, Br 7, for review.  jm

Defendant Kenyata Antwone Course in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Presentence report reviewed.  Statements made as to sentencing.  
AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 36 MONTHS, with credit for 31 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS.  The court did not address if the defendant is/is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is/is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
AS TO COUNT 2: The court sentenced the defendant to 9 months consecutive in the HOC.
AS TO COUNT 3: The court sentenced the defendant to 9 months consecutive in the HOC.
The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 4 YEARS with the following conditions:  
*Serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction with good time credit and huber for work and childcare not to exceed 60 hours a week. The defendant has a report date of 6.10.16 before 12pm. 
*AODA assessment and follow through with recommended programming; 
*Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens.
Defendant to register as a sex offender for 5 years.
Defendant to undergo a sex offender evaluation and comply with any treatment deemed necessary.
NO CONTACT ORDER REMAINS.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs to paid over the duration of probation failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges over the duration of probation or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,

Defendant Kenyata Antwone Course in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

CASE HEARD BY BRANCH 6 FOR BRANCH 7.

Amended information, received and filed, amending COUNT 1 to EXPOSING GENITALS, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.10(1), a Class I Felony, and adding COUNTS 2 & 3, 4TH DEGREE SEXUAL ASSAULT, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s)940.225(3m), a Class A Misdemeanor.

Copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of amended information, waives formal reading, momentarily pleads not guilty.

AMENDED COUNT 1 AND COUNTS 2 & 3:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and Elements of the Offense/Jury instruction received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information/Complaint.  Judgment of conviction entered.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  PSI was/not ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kenyata Antwone Course in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court addressed missed phone contact with Justice Point. Court ordered that Justice Point verify that the defendant was at work on 05/26/2015 and 05/27/2015. Court ordered Justice Point to inform the Court if on 05/25/2015 they were open for monitoring and/or telephone contacts. Court also ordered that Justice Point inform the Court immediately of any further violations. Defense counsel advised the Court that he has a firm trial scheduled to begin on 06/15/2015 in Branch 38. Court did not take any action at this time. Defendant no longer wishes to proceed with a plea in this case. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 06/17/2015 in Branch 25. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Defendant Kenyata Antwone Course in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Motion Hearing. Defendant Kenyata Antwone Course in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea Hearing. Defense requests an adjourned plea hearing date. State objects. Court denied defense request and ordered the matter be set for Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Defense made oral motion requesting a Miranda/Goodchild Hearing. Court acknowledged defense motion. State to subpoena witnesses for possible testimony. Parties to file motions by 3/30/2015. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to branch 25.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.
